answers.answer: Also I just read a post about taking the injections during your period. I am barely thru menopause, what does that do for me? How is that handled? Would I keep taking the injections because I don't have a period anymore?

generally the cost is 400-600$ per area PER TREATMENT, however the treatments are 3-4 weeks apart.  Unfortunately some office require 50% of payment up front.  Note that the area on abdomen can take 6-10 treatments, the arms(which count as only ONE area) take not so many.for the "double chin" I think I've gotten best results and that only takes 2-3 treatments for which I only charge 100$ per treatment since dose used is so small and procedure so quick. I don't personally make people pay 1/2 first....and I have excellent return rate of patients coming back so I know I"ll get paid eventually.Dr John Capps, Complete Wellness, Rock Hill, SC

question: I recently saw Lipodissolve advertised on tv. I live near Springfield Missouri. I would like to know approximate prices and the names of any offices that anyone can recommend. How does it work with someone who is diabetic? My main problem area is my belly, after that would be my inner thighs and the loose hanging under my upper arms.
title: Lipodissolve and Diabetes
